abstract.text: A reader session for detecting ISO7816, ISO15693, FeliCa, and MIFARE tags.

inlineContent.text: Use NFCTagReaderSession to interact with one of the tag types listed in
. To use this reader session, you must:
Provide a non-empty string for the
To interact with ISO 7816 tags, add the list of the application identifiers supported in your app to the
information property list key. If you include the application identifier
—the identifier for the NDEF application on MIFARE DESFire tags (NFC Forum T4T tag platform)—and the reader session finds a tag matching this identifier, it sends the delegate an
tag object. To get the MIFARE DESFire tag as an
Only one reader session of any type can be active in the system at a time. The system puts additional sessions in a queue and processes them in first-in, first-out (FIFO) order.
Core NFC doesn’t support payment-related Application IDs.

abstract.text: Detect NFC tags, read messages that contain NDEF data, and save data to writable tags.
An interface for interacting with an ISO 7816 tag.
An interface for interacting with a MIFARE® tag.
A reader session for detecting NFC Data Exchange Format (NDEF) tags.
The abstract base class that represents a reader session for detecting NFC tags.
A collection of callbacks that provide information about the status of an NFC reader session.
A general interface for interacting with a reader session.
A reader session for detecting ISO7816, ISO15693, FeliCa, and MIFARE tags.
Options that determine the type of tags that a reader session should detect during a polling sequence.
Connects the reader session to a tag and activates that tag.
Connects the reader session to a tag and activates that tag.
The tag connected to the reader session.
The tag connected to the reader session.
Creates an NFC tag reader session.
Intializes an NFC tag reader session.
Restarts the polling sequence so the reader session can discover new tags.
A protocol that an object implements to receive callbacks sent from an NFC tag reader session.
A protocol that an object implements to receive callbacks sent from an NFC tag reader session.
Constants that identify the type of an NFC tag.
A reader session for processing Value Added Service (VAS) tags.
The Near Field Communication data formats an app can read.

abstract.text: A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s NFC hardware.
A list of application identifiers that the app supports.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
